text.p: Task 3B) After obtaining the rotation angle in radians, you can calculate the distance to move the car in the x and y directions by using simple math equations. Given the distance we want to move the car and the rotation angle in radians, the distance to move in x and y directions can be calculated as follows:

p.center: Distance to Move in x Direction = Distance to Move * cos(Angle of Rotation)
Distance to Move in y Direction = Distance to Move * sin(Angle of Rotation)

text.p: By using the methods sin and cos in the Java Math class here, write a piece of Java code in the textbox provided below to calculate the distance to move in the x direction and the distance to move in the y direction and store the calculated distances to the double variables distX and distY respectively.
Let's assume that the int variable dist and the double variable rotationInRadians have been declared to store the distance to move and the current rotation angle of the car in radians respectively.
